item.title: Tanya add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "No single thing abides; and all things are fucked up." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Colette
item.description: "You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm." -- Colette

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Noel Coward
item.description: "My importance to the world is relatively small. On the other hand, my importance to myself is tremendous. I am all I have to work with, to play with, to suffer and to enjoy. It is not the eyes of others that I am wary of, but of my own. I do not intend to let myself down more than I can possibly help, and I find that the fewer illusions I have about myself or the world around me, the better company I am for myself." -- Noel Coward

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "To ask an author who hopes to be a serious writer if his work is autobiographical is like asking a spider where he buys his thread. The spider gets his thread right out of his own guts, and that is where the author gets his writing." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Tanya add a quote by Daniil Kharms
item.description: "I was most happy when pen and paper were taken from me and I was forbidden from doing anything. I had no anxiety about doing nothing by my own fault, my conscience was clear, and I was happy. This was when I was in prison." -- Daniil Kharms

item.title: Tanya add a quote by David Lynch
item.description: "There's a safety in thinking in a diner. You can have your coffee or your milkshake, and you can go off into strange dark areas, and always come back to the safety of the diner." -- David Lynch
